intro: Trautvetteria nervata, commonly known as the veined trautvetteria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and lance-shaped leaves with prominent veins. Its flowers are typically pink to purple, with five petals and numerous stamens. Trautvetteria nervata is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
